required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of the Predictive Criteria of Severity for Respiratory Infection Due to COVID-19 Virus
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of the Predictive Criteria of Severity Related to Patient Calling Emergency Centre for Low or High Respiratory Infection With or Without Fever and Suspected to be COVID-19.

brief_summary.textblock: Emergency call centers are very solicited in epidemic situations. It is necessary to detect early Predictive Criteria of Severity in COVID respiratory infection to identify patients at risk of complication or aggravation from an emergency call center in order to adapt their orientation and their medical management.

primary_outcome.description: Hospitalization declared by the patient 1 month after his call to the emergency call center

intervention.description: Follow-up phone call after month to detect which patient have been hospitalized

study_pop.textblock: All patient (more than 15 years old) calling the emergency call center (15 center) for Low or High Respiratory Infection With or Without Fever and Suspected

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient (more than 15 years old) calling the emergency call center (15 center) for Low or High Respiratory Infection With or Without Fever and Suspected to be COVID
Exclusion Criteria:
- unknown contact facility
- call not regulated by a practitioner from the medical emergency help team
